title: Crazy lag spikes?
body:
So, I just got back into league, and it's going pretty well. The only problem is these crazy lag spikes I get, they range from 1,000 to about 4,000 ping and last for up to ten seconds. In multiple games, I've had about five of these spikes before the fifteen minute mark. 
At first I thought it was my connection, but I ruled it out because every other MoBa and every other online multiplayer game doesn't suffer from any spikes.
Dota2 - No Lag
CS:GO - No Lag
Smite - Minimal Lag
HoN - No Lag

Does anyone else have this problem? If it's a serverside or an update problem that will be patched out I can push through it. But if it's a problem on my side that I can not fix (or something that RIOT is unwilling to fix), I'm not going to put time or money into a game that gives me these problems.
Thanks in advance!

replies.body:
I'm unable to find any recorded incidents server-side, so I'm inclined to believe this is caused by poor routing to our servers, as is commonly the case. I recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to confirm your local network settings are compatible with League before we investigate further.

Let me know if those steps caused any change in your latency.

I tried all of those things except the Internet Protocol version 4 changes (and port forwarding, because I always manage to mess something up). Trying the Protocol Version 4 changes now, will update after a game.
Update: We won, but the lag was the same, nothing changed.

I'm glad to hear you won but sad to hear the issue wasn't resolved. I am now happy-sad. :) :(

I'd like you to run some traceroutes so we can get a good peek at your network routing to the servers. First, grab a network app called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/). Next, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field, then start the trace. After 5 minutes has passed by, export your results as text and paste them here in a reply.

Let me know if you run into issues taking those steps.

This has been happening to myself and many people for a few days now. Rioter response is pretty much always a variation of the one you got (linking to the connection guide). Guess we just gotta wait it out.{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

I've been getting this since one of the patches mid S5. I usually play around it, but it really becomes a problem when I get placed with people in skill brackets well above my own (also a problem rito). I'm going to do the test suggested above by Targons Blade, and see what that does for me.
Test Results to follow.
